**QUING23 – Engineering Regional Source List**
================

### Tender Details

* **Reference Number**: MX-22700747713
* **Publication Date**: March 8, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date**: April 27, 2023, at 2:00 PM EST
* **Amendment Number**: 3
* **Contracting Entity**: Defence Construction Canada / Construction de Défense Canada
* **Contact Information**: Jacob Lachapelle, [Jacob.Lachapelle@dcc-cdc.gc.ca](mailto:Jacob.Lachapelle@dcc-cdc.gc.ca), 343-550-4560

### Tender Description

Defence Construction Canada (DCC) is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the establishment of a Source List (SL) to provide consulting services for the Department of National Defence (DND) in the regions of Eastern and Central Canada. The SL will comprise a list of pre-qualified consultants for various engineering disciplines, including mechanical, electrical, civil, and architectural.

### Key Requirements

* The SL will be valid for a period of two (2) years, with a maximum estimated value of $7,000,000.00.
* Commissions under the SL will be valued between $100,000.00 and $250,000.00, with a maximum value of $350,000.00.
* The SL will cover various engineering disciplines, including Project Management, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Civil Engineering, and Architecture.
* The Selection Committee will evaluate proposals based on established criteria, including technical expertise, experience, and price.

### Bidding and Access to Documents

Bidding and documents are available on [www.merx.com](http://www.merx.com). Fees may apply; please visit [https://www.merx.com/public/pricing](https://www.merx.com/public/pricing) for more information.

### Notice URL

* English: https://www.merx.com/public/solicitations/2437765401/abstract?language=EN
* French: https://www.merx.com/public/solicitations/2437765401/abstract?language=FR

### Trade Agreements

This tenders is subject to various trade agreements, including the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), and the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).
